overview: Jason Beck is responsible for all internal and external communications, including media strategy, public relations, and brand development. As an Army Captain, Jason served as the Deputy Public Affairs Officer for Task Force 1st Armored Division in Baghdad, Iraq, where he oversaw and coordinated with all international media and local Iraqi media for which he was subsequently awarded the Bronze Star. Jason brings a unique perspective from having served also as a US Army Intelligence Officer in South Korea where he led Human Intelligence (HUMINT) activities for the 2nd Infantry Division. Jason has a B.A. in Political Science from The University of the South (Sewanee) and is a graduate of the Defense Information School (DINFOS) at Fort Meade, Maryland. He currently sits on the board for a local economic development initiative, advises several non-profits and is the commander of an Army Reserve Public Affairs detachment in Nashville, Tennessee.
